alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 6:37PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Mud/debris flows onto roads are also possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko. * WHEN...Until 945 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kittridge Creek, Sheep Creek, South Fork Humboldt River, Tenmile Creek, Dixie Creek and Humboldt River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Fork Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
